content: The Act titled "Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002" ensures that federal employees in the uniformed services or National Guard do not have their pay reduced while performing active service. READY RESERVE-NATIONAL GUARD EMPLOYEE CREDIT added to the Internal Revenue Code for business-related credits. The Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit under section 38 is 50% of the actual compensation amount for the taxable year. The actual compensation amount is the employer's payment for a Ready Reserve-National Guard employee on a day of qualified active duty absence. The Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit under section 38 allows employers to claim 50% of the compensation paid for a day of qualified active duty absence, with a maximum credit period of 12 months. No credit is given for days when the employee was not scheduled to work. The term 'qualified active duty' refers to active duty excluding training duty, entitling an employee to reemployment rights, benefits, or a leave of absence from employment.
